page.title: 06Lovington School
page.content: Lovington School,one of the oldest in Somerset,was started in 1716 when a kind farmer bequeathed the rents of 9 acres of pasture land at Foddington to be used for the schooling of the "poor children of Lovington for ever". Today, up to 40 children from a wide area attend the school, very few actually living in Lovington.Two full time staff teach one class of Infants and one of Juniors in the old but well equipped schoolroom. Parents and villagers provide strong support at social events and take part in work projects and fund raising. Attempts to close the school have twice been thwarted by public pressure because of its importance as the centre of village life.
